bibliographic-data.invention-title: OCR Enabled Management of Accounts Payable and/or Accounts Receivable Auditing Data

abstract.p: A number of different tags are input in a fax cover sheet that tell an OCR system not only the identity of the supplier, but also to which client the document should be routed. The OCR system identifies a number of these tags and compares them to stored supplier data to validate to which supplier the document belongs. If the system cannot validate the document, it is routed to a GUI for manual sorting. If there is no coversheet, the system relies upon the OCR system to locate keywords on the document and caller ID information to suggest a correct supplier. The OCR system also clips a separate, horizontal slice of the document ('snippet) that corresponds to the display of any line item and places it in a data base for future reference and reporting. The application collects and associates all corresponding snippets to their originating line items.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Method and system of managing accounts payable auditing data

abstract.p: The present invention provides a method and system of managing accounts payable auditing data, where the auditing data includes at least one line item and is ordered by a propensity to yield claims. The method and system, in an exemplary embodiment, includes (1) displaying at least one aged line item, (2) identifying credit data among the at least one displayed aged line item, and (3) recording the identified credit data. In an exemplary embodiment, the aged line item is a line item that has aged for N months, where N is positive integer. In an exemplary embodiment, N is 4.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Method and system of managing accounts payable auditing data

abstract.p: The present invention provides a method and system of managing accounts payable auditing data, where the auditing data includes at least one line item and is ordered by a propensity to yield claims. The method and system, in an exemplary embodiment, includes (1) displaying at least one aged line item, (2) identifying credit data among the at least one displayed aged line item, and (3) recording the identified credit data. In an exemplary embodiment, the aged line item is a line item that has aged for N months, where N is positive integer. In an exemplary embodiment, N is 4.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD AND SYSTEM OF MANAGING ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AUDITING DATA
PROCEDE ET SYSTEME DE GESTION DE DONNEES DE VERIFICATION DE COMPTES CREDITEURS

abstract.p: The present invention provides a method and system of managing accounts payable auditing data, where the auditing data includes at least one line item and is ordered by a propensity to yield claims. The method and system, in an exemplary embodiment, includes 1 displaying at least one aged line item, 2 identifying credit data among the at least one displayed aged line item, and 3 recording the identified credit data. In an exemplary embodiment, the aged line item is a line item that has aged for N months, where N is positive integer. In an exemplary embodiment, N. is 4.

The present invention provides a method and system of managing accounts payable auditing data, where the auditing data includes at least one line item and is ordered by a propensity to yield claims. The method and system, in an exemplary embodiment, includes (1) displaying at least one aged line item, (2) identifying credit data among the at least one displayed aged line item, and (3) recording the identified credit data. In an exemplary embodiment, the aged line item is a line item that has aged for N months, where N is positive integer. In an exemplary embodiment, N. is 4.

La présente invention concerne un procédé et un système de gestion de données de vérification de comptes créditeurs, lesdites données de vérification contenant au moins un poste et étant classées selon leur propension à susciter des créances. Dans un mode de réalisation illustratif, le procédé consiste à (1) afficher au moins un poste des comptes clients, (2) identifier des données de crédit parmi au moins un poste de comptes clients affiché, et (3) enregistrer les données de crédit identifiées. Dans un mode de réalisation illustratif, le poste de comptes clients est un poste qui remonte à N mois, N désignant un entier positif. Dans un mode de réalisation illustratif, N désigne 4.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD AND SYSTEM OF MANAGING ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AUDITING DATA
PROCEDE ET SYSTEME DE GESTION DE DONNEES DE VERIFICATION DE COMPTES CREDITEURS

abstract.p: The present invention provides a method and system of managing accounts payable auditing data, where the auditing data includes at least one line item and is ordered by a propensity to yield claims. The method and system, in an exemplary embodiment, includes: 1) displaying at least one aged line item, 2) identifying credit data among the at least one displayed aged line item, and 3) recording the identified credit data. In an exemplary embodiment, the aged line item is a line item that has aged for N months, where N is positive integer. In an exemplary embodiment, N is 4.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: OCR ENABLED MANAGEMENT OF ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AND/OR ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE AUDITING DATA
GESTION PAR OCR DE DONNÉES D'AUDIT DE COMPTES FOURNISSEURS ET/OU DE COMPTES CLIENTS

abstract.p: A number of different tags are input in a fax cover sheet that tell an OCR system not only the identity of the supplier, but also to which client the document should be routed. The OCR system identifies a number of these tags and compares them to stored supplier data to validate to which supplier the document belongs. If the system cannot validate the document, it is routed to a GUI for manual sorting. If there is no coversheet, the system relies upon the OCR system to locate keywords on the document and caller ID information to suggest a correct supplier. The OCR system also clips a separate, horizontal slice of the document ('snippet') that corresponds to the display of any line item and places it in a data base for future reference and reporting. The application collects and associates all corresponding snippets to their originating line items.

Il est entré sur une page de garde de télécopie un certain nombre d'étiquettes différentes qui renseignent un système OCR non seulement sur l'identité du fournisseur mais également sur le client vers lequel le document devrait être acheminé. Le système OCR identifie un certain nombre de ces étiquettes et les compare à des données de fournisseurs mémorisées de façon à confirmer à quel fournisseur le document appartient. Si le système ne peut pas confirmer le document, ce dernier est acheminé jusqu'à une interface graphique utilisateur en vue d'un tri manuel. En l'absence de page de garde, le système se fie au système OCR pour localiser les mots clés sur le document et aux informations sur l'ID de l'appelant pour suggérer un fournisseur correct.

De plus, le système OCR sélectionne une tranche horizontale séparée du document ( fragment ) qui correspond à l'affichage d'un quelconque élément de ligne et la place dans une base de données en vue d'une référence et d'un rapport ultérieurs. L'application collecte et associe tous les fragments correspondants à leur élément de ligne d'origine.
